content.thinking:
The user wants to create screenshots for all pages in this project. Let me first understand what pages exist in this application by exploring the codebase structure.

This appears to be a Next.js application based on the file structure mentioned (app/cart/page.tsx). I should:
1. First, explore the codebase to find all the pages
2. Understand what the application looks like
3. Then think about how to create screenshots

Let me start by exploring the app directory to see what pages exist.

2. Use a tool like Playwright (which I see is already in node_modules) to take screenshots

Let me check if there's a package.json to understand the project setup better, and see if Playwright is configured.

{
  "name": "octodeco-template",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next dev",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start",
    "lint": "eslint",
    "test": "vitest",
    "test:ui": "vitest --ui",
    "test:run": "vitest run",
    "test:e2e": "playwright test",
    "test:e2e:ui": "playwright test --ui",
    "test:e2e:headed": "playwright test --headed"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "next": "16.1.1",
    "react": "19.2.3",
    "react-dom": "19.2.3"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@playwright/test": "^1.58.2",
    "@tailwindcss/postcss": "^4",
    "@testing-library/jest-dom": "^6.9.1",
    "@testing-library/react": "^16.3.2",
    "@types/node": "^20.19.33",
    "@types/react": "^19",
    "@types/react-dom": "^19",
    "@vitest/ui": "^4.0.18",

    "happy-dom": "^20.6.1",
    "tailwindcss": "^4",
    "typescript": "^5",
    "vitest": "^4.0.18"
  }
}

content.thinking: Ah, there's already a Next.js dev server running on port 3000, and when it tried to use port 3002, it encountered a lock issue. It seems there's another instance running. Let me kill the background process I just started and check if there's already a server running I can use. If port 3000 is in use, let me try connecting to it.

input.description: Check if server is already running on port 3000

content.content: Shell bd232cb is not running, so cannot be killed (status: failed)

toolUseResult: Error: Shell bd232cb is not running, so cannot be killed (status: failed)

content.content:
Exit code 7
000

content.thinking: The server on port 3000 isn't responding either. Let me check what's actually running and clean up any stale processes, then start fresh.

input.command: lsof -ti:3000 | xargs kill -9 2>/dev/null || echo "No process on port 3000"
rm -rf .next/dev/lock 2>/dev/null || echo "No lock file to remove"

content.thinking: Good, I've cleaned up. Now let me start the dev server again.

content.content: Command running in background with ID: bba3ac9. Output is being written to: /tmp/claude/-Users-bas-Projects-Stockholm-entire-test/tasks/bba3ac9.output

content.thinking: Great! Everything is complete. Let me summarize what was done for the user.

content.text:
Screenshots created successfully! I've captured all 4 pages in your Next.js application:

**Screenshots saved to ./screenshots/:**
- home.png (108K) - Home page at app/page.tsx
- products.png (920K) - Products page at app/products/page.tsx  
- cart.png (51K) - Cart page at app/cart/page.tsx
- checkout.png (918K) - Checkout page at app/checkout/page.tsx

I also created a reusable screenshot script at take-screenshots.js that you can run anytime with:
```bash
npm run dev  # Start server in one terminal
node take-screenshots.js  # Run in another terminal
```

All screenshots were captured at 1920x1080 resolution with full page height.
